title: How to Write in Spanish on Microsoft Word

steps.title: Add the Spanish language to the list of recognized languages for input words.
steps.content: Add the Spanish language to the list of recognized languages for input words. Open Tools menu from Menu bar, and select Language under the Set Language portion of the menu. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Understand the process to type in words of Spanish that contain accent marks and miscellaneous lettered marks.
steps.content: Understand the process to type in words of Spanish that contain accent marks and miscellaneous lettered marks. You can either use the Alt key the Ctrl and the associated other key you'd like to add key methods to display the character. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Ensure that Num ⇩ is currently enabled.
steps.content: Ensure that Num ⇩ is currently enabled. Make sure the light on your keyboard for this key is currently lit. Press the Num ⇩ key, if it is not.

steps.title: Know the letter you'd like to create.
steps.content: Know the letter you'd like to create. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Locate the number that corresponds to the letter you'd like to use from Help with Microsoft Keyboards US-International table that lists all of the most-often typed characters for most any language that contains miscellaneous punctuation with letters.
steps.content: Locate the number that corresponds to the letter you'd like to use from Help with Microsoft Keyboards US-International table that lists all of the most-often typed characters for most any language that contains miscellaneous punctuation with letters.

steps.title: Press and hold down Alt until further notice.
steps.content: Press and hold down Alt until further notice. [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Type the number you just previously learned from the page using the numbers on the number pad section of the keyboard only.
steps.content: Type the number you just previously learned from the page using the numbers on the number pad section of the keyboard only.

steps.title: Release the Alt key, and the character should appear.
steps.content: Release the Alt key, and the character should appear. [5] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Ensure that Num ⇩ is currently enabled.
steps.content: Ensure that Num ⇩ is currently enabled. Make sure the light on your keyboard for this key is currently lit. Press Num ⇩ if the light has not been lit yet. [6] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Know the letter you'd like to create.
steps.content: Know the letter you'd like to create. [7] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Press and hold down Ctrl until further notice.
steps.content: Press and hold down Ctrl until further notice.

steps.title: Press the ' character once.
steps.content: Press the ' character once. Pressing this key will trigger Word to use the characters with the apostrophe on top of the letter. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Press the letter you'd like to enter that contains the apostrophe on top of it.
steps.content: Press the letter you'd like to enter that contains the apostrophe on top of it. (It will even work, if you type an uppercase letter instead.) [9] X Research source

steps.title: Press and hold down the Ctrl+Alt+⇧ Shift until further notice.
steps.content: Press and hold down the Ctrl + Alt + ⇧ Shift until further notice.

steps.title: Press the ? or ! on your keyboard.
steps.content: Press the ? or ! on your keyboard.

steps.title: Release all the buttons at once.
steps.content: Release all the buttons at once.
